figure_1.title: Fig. 1.
figure_1.caption: Genes associated with germline predisposition for hematologic neoplasms and their chromosomal location. Blue: genes recognized as myeloid neoplasms with germ line predisposition by the WHO in 2016. Red: genes published afterwards

claims.sentence: C Patients not fulfilling the criteria A and B diagnosed with MDS or AML before the age of 50 carrying aberrations of chromosome 7 [monosomy 7/del(7q)/der(7)]In the meantime, a number of additional risk gene loci have been identified (Fig. 1) [12].
